page.title: 12OLD RAILWAY
page.content: The railway ran from Salford Priors to Broom where there was a junction.At the junction it carried on towards Birmingham and in the other direction to Stratford.You could also travel to Tewkesbury from Salford Priors.The railway ran along the stream for quite some time.It ran over the Worcester meadows.The railway was built in 1863 and it was completed in 1866.It was used for around 100 years .The railway ran through 21 villages.It used to cost 5d to travel to Broom from here (Broom is 3/4 of a mile away from Salford station).10 passenger trains and 4 freight trains would run on it in a day.If you walk down the railway you will see a little building on the left it is used for weighing-it was called the weighbridge.There is also a building which was used for loading and unloading the trains.
